comment.author: 69778605@N08
comment._content: According to ancestry.com BMD records he was was born in Cheltenham in 1894

comment.author: 8498561@N08
comment._content:
Born Cheltenham 30th June 1894.
1911 Census:
Son of Henry Maybrey (Music Teacher) and younger brother of Herbert John Maybrey (b 1893 - elementary school teacher).  Address 10 Grenville Terrace, Cheltenham.
26/01/1915 gazetted Second Lieutenant (London Gazette)
10/Gloucesters landed in France 08/08/1915 & transfered to 1st Brigade of 1st Division on 17/08/1915.

Killed in Action, aged 22. together with 6 men of the battalion.
Commemorated on Cranham War Memorial, Gloucestershire.

Brother Herbert John served as a Lieutenant in the Worcestershire Regiment (gazetted 16/11/1914)

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: 10th (Service) Battalion Gloucestershire Regiment was formed at Bristol in September 1914 as part of Kitchener’s Third draft and attached as Army Troops to 26th Division.  They initially moved to Salisbury Plain and in November 1914 were in billets in Cheltenham.  They returned to Salisbury Plain for further training in April 1915 and landed in France on 8 August 1915.  On 17 August 1915 they were transferred to 1st Brigade in 1st Division with whom, in 1916, they were committed to the Battle of the Somme.//

comment._content:

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
Brother, Herbert John Maybrey birth reg 2nd qr 1893 in Cheltenham
Marr reg 1st qr 1918 to Mary C Love in Marylebone
Death reg 2nd qr 1942 in Bromley age 48
